text:
I guess you can read this title in two ways: "A terrible monster which attacks the crew" or "A terrible crew which attacks monsters."

Nonetheless, this is one of the hidden gems in the world of battle themes.

text:
I'm surprised that series made it all the way to 5. The first one was bad enough.

author: Talking Too Much About Games

text:
The first one was actually great. It is even considered the best one. Heck, they even made a remake on the PS2. 

Personally though, Wild Arms 3 is my all time fave.

If I have to personally rank them, its  3, 1, 5, 2, and 4.
author: Lorenzo Lyle Abadia

text: Lorenzo Lyle Abadia Wild ARMS 1 aged very poorly, from what I can tell.  The general consensus is that Wild ARMS 1, 3, and 5 are the best ones, with 4 being a laughingstock and 2 being somewhat boring.
